trustfund:
TF034453-PERU - BASIC HEALTH, NUTRITION
            AND FONCODES II

abstracts.cdata!:
The project is rated satisfactory, with
            a sustainable likelihood, and moderate institutional
            development impacts. Lessons address: 1) sustainability
            issues, to be assessed during appraisal, by including
            socioeconomic, and institutional analysis of the beneficiary
            community, whose results should enhance, and be reflected in
            project design, and implementation. Despite the efficient
            nature of the community agent "Nucleo Ejecutor"
            (NE), its short-term character, limits its contribution to
            project sustainability; thus it should be reviewed whether
            its responsibility to follow-up, on the transfer of the
            project to the appropriate entity, could be feasible; 2)
            empowerment issues, i.e., participation depends on the
            existing social capital. Thus, where communities are weak,
            it would be appropriate to have proactive strategies,
            including a promotional component, rather than demand-driven
            schemes, even though, as in this case, these may be
            considered assets to the National Fund for Compensation and
            Development's (FONCODES) projects, but are not the
            instrument of choice for the poorest communities; 3)
            targeting issues, where local governments have a key role to
            play in the micro-level targeting, and, communities should
            also be involved in promotion interventions, prioritizing
            the poorer communities, who have not benefited from FONCODES
            financing. The role of governments, and of Social Funds in
            the promotion, and financing of productive projects should
            be reviewed.
